page.title: 19URBAN WILDLIFE IN JARROW
page.content: Walking around{Urban Jarrow }you would be surprised how much wildlife you can find despite the houses. At the Box's, which is the local name for an area of rough ground once owned by the Box family (site of Hedworth Hall grid ref 337631 burned to the ground in 1972) there are animals and insects to be seen. In Box's there are blackberry bushes where thrushes keep their anvil stones. It is an ideal place as there are many banded snails on the plants. In one of the bushes was a Privet Hawk Moth. Under the stones were woodlice, a slug, a jumping spider and a "harvest man". Nearby were quite a few birds e.g. Sparrows, crows,seagulls and housemartins.
